result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy L Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition  of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  All these amounts and applicable fees of supervision fees to be paid by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Release Program after four (4) years of confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program after 4 years of confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero;
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Ineligible Voting Notice
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Marquise L. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26202701 in court 1x on 8/18/14.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Janquishlan A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26202620 in court 2x on 8/18/14, 8/20/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/21/14 for Janquishlan A. for 2 appearances on 8/18/14, 8/20/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/21/14 for Marquise L . for 1 appearance on 8/18/14.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury question received during the lunch hour was read on the record.  The jurors continued deliberations, and reached a verdict.  Therefore the question was not answered.

At the hour of 1:48pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury back in the box at 9:24am.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Brittany C, re-called Milwaukee Police Detective Kenton Burch and Rashanna J.
Exhibit 2 received.  Defense re-called as rebuttal witness Milwaukee Police Detective Kenton Burch.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:59am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Hadfield and Klatkiewicz who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury back in back at 1:28pm.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Marquise L, Milwaukee Police Officer Patrick Lewis, Milwaukee Police Officer Martez Ball, and Milwaukee Police Detective Kenton Burch.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.   Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Troy Allen.  Defense rests.  At the hour of 4:23pm the jury was dismissed for the day, but told to return 08/19/2014 at 8:30am.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:32am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  
At 11:49am the jury was dismissed for lunch and instructed to return at 1:10pm.  Jury out of box.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
SPEEDY JURY TRIAL DEMAND, previously filed on 05-27-2014 WITHDRAWN by Defendant's Counsel, and REFILED ORALLY ON THE RECORD UNDER TODAY'S DATE.  SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for 08-18-2014 at 09:00am.

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Troy L Allen not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to the untimely arrival of defendant's counsel while jury trial was taking place in Branch 22, Final Pretrial is adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Court informs Attorney Peirce, off the record, that Speedy Trial,  previously scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 09:00am, will not take place as scheduled due to inability to address matters in Court on today.   SPEEDY Jury Trial removed from 06-09-2014 at 09:00am Calendar.  Rescheduling of Speedy Jury Trial will take place during Final Pretrial Hearing.  Final Pretrial Hearing adjourned to 06-09-2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.
FILE TO REMAIN IN COURTROOM PENDING FINAL PRETRIAL HEARING.

FILED.
SPEEDY Jury Trial must be heard prior on or before 08-25-2014.  Jury Trial already set for 06-09-2014 at 09:00am in Branch 22.
DEFENDANT'S NOTICE OF ALIBI

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Troy L Allen not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Jury trial scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kenton Burtch-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marquise L

Defendant Troy L Allen in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Troy L Allen in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
